slokas: अर्जुन उवाचज्यायसी चेत्कर्मणस्ते मता बुद्धिर्जनार्दन ।तत्किं कर्मणि घोरे मां नियोजयसि केशव ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: If you consider knowledge superior to action, O Janardana, then why do you engage me in this terrible action, O Keshava?

slokas: व्यामिश्रेणेव वाक्येन बुद्धिं मोहयसीव मे ।तदेकं वद निश्चित्य येन श्रेयोऽहमाप्‍नुयाम् ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: With seemingly confused words, you seem to bewilder my understanding. Therefore, tell me decisively one thing by which I may attain welfare.

slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचलोकेऽस्मिन्द्विविधा निष्ठा पुरा प्रोक्ता मयानघ ।ज्ञानयोगेन सांख्यानां कर्मयोगेन योगिनाम् ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: The Blessed Lord said: In this world, there is a twofold path, as I have declared before, O sinless one: the path of knowledge for the Sankhyas and the path of action for the Yogis.

slokas: न कर्मणामनारम्भान्नैष्कर्म्य पुरुषोऽश्न‍ुते ।न च सन्न्यसनादेव सिद्धिं समधिगच्छति ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: A person does not attain freedom from action by abstaining from work, nor does he achieve perfection merely by renunciation.

slokas: न हि कश्चित्क्षणमपि जातु तिष्ठत्यकर्मकृत् ।कार्यते ह्यवशः कर्म सर्वः प्रकृतिजैर्गुणैः ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: Indeed, no one ever remains even for a moment without performing action; everyone is driven to action, helplessly, by the qualities born of nature.

slokas: कर्मेन्द्रियाणि संयम्य य आस्ते मनसा स्मरन् ।इन्द्रियार्थान्विमूढात्मा मिथ्याचारः स उच्यते ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: One who restrains the organs of action but whose mind dwells on sense objects, such a deluded person is called a hypocrite.

slokas: यस्त्विन्द्रियाणि मनसा नियम्यारभतेऽर्जुन ।कर्मेन्द्रियैः कर्मयोगमसक्तः स विशिष्यते ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: He who, controlling the senses by the mind, O Arjuna, engages in the yoga of action with the organs of action, without attachment, excels.

slokas: नियतं कुरु कर्म त्वं कर्म ज्यायो ह्यकर्मणः ।शरीरयात्रापि च ते न प्रसिद्ध्येदकर्मणः ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: Perform your prescribed duties, for action is better than inaction. Even the maintenance of the body would not be possible without action.

slokas: यज्ञार्थात्कर्मणोऽन्यत्र लोकोऽयं कर्मबन्धनः ।तदर्थं कर्म कौन्तेय मुक्तसङ्गः समाचर ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: Apart from action performed for the sake of sacrifice, this world is bound by action. Therefore, O Kaunteya (Arjuna), perform action for that purpose alone, free from attachment.

slokas: सहयज्ञाः प्रजाः सृष्ट्वा पुरोवाच प्रजापतिः ।अनेन प्रसविष्यध्वमेष वोऽस्त्विष्टकामधुक् ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: Having created mankind along with sacrifices, Prajapati (the Creator) said in the beginning: "By this (sacrifice) shall you prosper; let this be the milker of your desires."

slokas: देवान्भावयतातेन ते देवा भावयन्तु वः ।परस्परं भावयन्तः श्रेयः परमवाप्स्यथ ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: Nourish the gods with this, and may those gods nourish you. By nourishing one another, you shall attain the highest good.

slokas: इष्टान्भोगान्हि वो देवा दास्यन्ते यज्ञभाविताः ।तैर्दत्तानप्रदायैभ्यो यो भुङ्क्ते स्तेन एव सः ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: The gods, nourished by sacrifices, will indeed grant you desired enjoyments. One who enjoys what is given by them without offering to them is verily a thief.

slokas: यज्ञशिष्टाशिनः सन्तो मुच्यन्ते सर्वकिल्बिषै ।भुञ्जते ते त्वघं पापा ये पचन्त्यात्मकारणात् ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: The virtuous who partake of the remnants of sacrifice are freed from all sins. But those sinful ones who cook only for themselves eat sin.

slokas: अन्नाद्भ‍वन्ति भूतानि पर्जन्यादन्नसम्भवः ।यज्ञा‍द्भ‍‍वति पर्जन्यो यज्ञः कर्मसमुद्भ‍वः ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: From food, beings are born; from rain, food is produced. From sacrifice, rain arises; sacrifice is born of action.

slokas: कर्म ब्रह्मोद्भ‍वं विद्धि ब्रह्माक्षरसमुद्भ‍वम् ।तस्मात्सर्वगतं ब्रह्म नित्यं यज्ञे प्रतिष्ठितम् ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: Know that action arises from Brahman, and Brahman arises from the imperishable. Therefore, the all-pervading Brahman is eternally established in sacrifice.

slokas: एवं प्रवर्तितं चक्रं नानुवर्तयतीह यः ।अघायुरिन्द्रियारामो मोघं पार्थ स जीवति ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: Thus, the one who does not follow the wheel of creation set in motion here, indulging in sense pleasures, lives in vain, O Partha.

slokas: यस्त्वात्मरतिरेव स्यादात्मतृप्त‍श्च मानवः ।आत्मन्येव च सन्तुष्टस्तस्य कार्यं न विद्यते ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: One who finds joy in the self alone, who is satisfied with the self, and who is content in the self, for him there is no duty.

slokas: नैव तस्य कृतेनार्थो नाकृतेनेह कश्चन ।न चास्य सर्वभूतेषु कश्चिदर्थव्यपाश्रयः ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: He has no purpose to gain by doing action, nor any purpose to lose by not doing action; nor is there any dependence on any being for him.

slokas: तस्मादसक्तः सततं कार्यं कर्म समाचर ।असक्तो ह्याचरन्कर्म परमाप्‍नोति पूरूषः ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: Therefore, perform your duty constantly without attachment; for by performing action without attachment, a person attains the Supreme.

slokas: कर्मणैव हि संसिद्धिमास्थिता जनकादयः ।लोकसङ्ग्रहमेवापि सम्पश्यन्कर्तुमर्हसि ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: By action alone did Janaka and others attain perfection. You should perform action also with a view to the guidance of the world.

slokas: यद्यदाचरति श्रेष्ठस्तत्तदेवेतरो जनः ।स यत्प्रमाणं कुरुते लोकस्तदनुवर्तते ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: Whatever a great person does, others follow. Whatever standard they set, the world follows.

slokas: न मे पार्थास्ति कर्तव्यं त्रिषु लोकेषु किञ्चन ।नानवाप्त‍मवाप्त‍व्यं वर्त एव च कर्मणि ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: In the three worlds, O Partha, there is nothing that needs to be done by Me, nor is there anything unattained that should be attained; yet I engage in action.

slokas: यदि ह्यहं न वर्तेयं जातु कर्मण्यतन्द्रितः ।मम वर्त्मानुवर्तन्ते मनुष्याः पार्थ सर्वशः ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: If I did not engage in action tirelessly, O Partha, people would follow my path in every way.

slokas: उत्सीदेयुरिमे लोका न कुर्यां कर्म चेदहम् ।सङ्करस्य च कर्ता स्यामुपहन्यामिमाः प्रजाः ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: If I did not perform action, these worlds would perish; I would be the cause of confusion and would destroy these beings.

slokas: सक्ताः कर्मण्यविद्वांसो यथा कुर्वन्ति भारत ।कुर्याद्विद्वांस्तथासक्तश्चिकीर्षुर्लोकसङ्‍‍ग्रहम् ॥ २५ ॥
slokas_translated: As the ignorant act with attachment to work, O Bharata, so should the wise act without attachment, desiring the welfare of the world.

slokas: न बुद्धिभेदं जनयेदज्ञानां कर्मसङ्गिनाम् ।जोषयेत्सर्वकर्माणि विद्वान्युक्तः समाचरन् ॥ २६ ॥
slokas_translated: One should not create confusion in the minds of the ignorant who are attached to actions. The wise person, engaged in all actions, should encourage them to perform all actions.

slokas: प्रकृतेः क्रियमाणानि गुणैः कर्माणि सर्वशः ।अहङ्कारविमूढात्मा कर्ताहमिति मन्यते ॥ २७ ॥
slokas_translated: Actions are performed in every way by the qualities of nature. But one whose self is deluded by ego thinks, "I am the doer."

slokas: तत्त्ववित्तु महाबाहो गुणकर्मविभागयोः ।गुणा गुणेषु वर्तन्त इति मत्वा न सज्ज‍ते ॥ २८ ॥
slokas_translated: The one who knows the truth, O mighty-armed, about the division of qualities and actions, knowing that the qualities act upon the qualities, does not become attached.

slokas: प्रकृतेर्गुणसम्मूढाः सज्ज‍न्ते गुणकर्मसु ।तानकृत्स्नविदो मन्दान्कृत्स्नविन्न विचालयेत् ॥ २९ ॥
slokas_translated: Those who are deluded by the qualities of nature become attached to the actions of the qualities. The knower of the whole should not unsettle the ignorant who are deluded.

slokas: मयि सर्वाणि कर्माणि सन्न्यस्याध्यात्मचेतसा ।निराशीर्निर्ममो भूत्वा युध्यस्व विगतज्वरः ॥ ३० ॥
slokas_translated: Renouncing all actions in Me with a mind focused on the Self, free from hope and ego, fight without anxiety.

slokas: ये मे मतमिदं नित्यमनुतिष्ठन्ति मानवाः ।श्रद्धावन्तोऽनसूयन्तो मुच्यन्ते तेऽपि कर्मभिः ॥ ३१ ॥
slokas_translated: Those humans who constantly follow this teaching of mine, with faith and without envy, they too are freed from actions.

slokas: ये त्वेतदभ्यसूयन्तो नानुतिष्ठन्ति मे मतम् ।सर्वज्ञानविमूढांस्तान्विद्धि नष्टानचेतसः ॥ ३२ ॥
slokas_translated: But those who, out of envy, do not follow my teachings, know them to be deluded in all knowledge and doomed, devoid of understanding.

slokas: सदृशं चेष्टते स्वस्याः प्रकृतेर्ज्ञानवानपि ।प्रकृतिं यान्ति भूतानि निग्रहः किं करिष्यति ॥ ३३ ॥
slokas_translated: Even the wise act according to their own nature. All beings follow their nature. What will restraint accomplish?

slokas: इन्द्रियस्येन्द्रियस्यार्थे रागद्वेषौ व्यवस्थितौ ।तयोर्न वशमागच्छेत्तौ ह्यस्य परिपन्थिनौ ॥ ३४ ॥
slokas_translated: Attachment and aversion are established in each sense towards its objects; one should not come under their control, for they are indeed his adversaries.

slokas: श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात् ।स्वधर्मे निधनं श्रेयः परधर्मो भयावहः ॥ ३५ ॥
slokas_translated: Better is one's own duty, though devoid of merit, than the duty of another well-performed. Better is death in one's own duty; the duty of another is fraught with fear.

slokas: अर्जुन उवाचअथ केन प्रयुक्तोऽयं पापं चरति पूरुषः ।अनिच्छन्नपि वार्ष्णेय बलादिव नियोजितः ॥ ३६ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: O descendant of Vrishni, by what is one impelled to commit sin, even unwillingly, as if compelled by force?

slokas: श्री भगवानुवाचकाम एष क्रोध एष रजोगुणसमुद्भ‍वः ।महाशनो महापाप्मा विद्ध्येनमिह वैरिणम् ॥ ३७ ॥
slokas_translated: The Blessed Lord said: It is desire, it is anger, born of the mode of passion, all-devouring, and greatly sinful. Know this as the enemy here in this world.

slokas: धूमेनाव्रियते वह्निर्यथादर्शो मलेन च ।यथोल्बेनावृतो गर्भस्तथा तेनेदमावृत्तम् ॥ ३८ ॥
slokas_translated: As fire is covered by smoke, a mirror by dust, and an embryo by the womb, so is this covered.

slokas: आवृतं ज्ञानमेतेन ज्ञानिनो नित्यवैरिणा ।कामरूपेण कौन्तेय दुष्पूरेणानलेन च ॥ ३९ ॥
slokas_translated: Knowledge is covered by this eternal enemy of the wise, O son of Kunti, in the form of desire, which is insatiable and like a fire.

slokas: इन्द्रियाणि मनो बुद्धिरस्याधिष्ठानमुच्यते ।एतैर्विमोहयत्येष ज्ञानमावृत्य देहिनम् ॥ ४० ॥
slokas_translated: The senses, the mind, and the intellect are said to be its seat. With these, it deludes the embodied by covering knowledge. (Verse 40)

slokas: तस्मात्त्वमिन्द्रियाण्यादौ नियम्य भरतर्षभ ।पाप्मानं प्रजहि ह्येनं ज्ञानविज्ञाननाशनम् ॥ ४१ ॥
slokas_translated: Therefore, O best of the Bharatas, first restrain the senses and then destroy this sinful thing, which is the destroyer of knowledge and wisdom.

slokas: इन्द्रियाणि पराण्याहुरिन्द्रियेभ्यः परं मनः ।मनसस्तु परा बुद्धिर्यो बुद्धेः परतस्तु सः ॥ ४२ ॥
slokas_translated: The senses, they say, are superior; the mind is superior to the senses; the intellect is superior to the mind; and that which is superior to the intellect is He.

slokas: एवं बुद्धेः परं बुद्ध्वा संस्तभ्यात्मानमात्मना ।जहि शत्रुं महाबाहो कामरूपं दुरासदम् ॥ ४३ ॥
slokas_translated: Thus, knowing the self to be beyond the intellect, and restraining the self by the self, conquer the enemy in the form of desire, O mighty-armed one, which is difficult to overcome.
